intro: Tetrastigma obtectum var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed grapevine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its slender, smooth stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
